name: Chemicals | Antimony Trioxide
short_description:
Antimony trioxide is the inorganic compound with the formula Sb2O3. It is the most
important compound of antimony. It is found in nature as the minerals valentinite and
senarmontite. Antimony trioxide dissolves in aqueous solutions only with hydrolysis.
Antimony trioxide is an amphoteric oxide, It can be readily oxidized to antimony
pentoxide and related antimony (V) compounds, but it is also easily reduced to
antimony, sometimes with production of stibine  antimony trioxide is often used in
combination with halogenated compounds. Antimony trioxide is used as a synergist to
enhance the activity of the halogenated flame retardant.
summary: Antimony trioxide is the inorganic compound with the formula Sb2O3. It
